boardgame.name: Abrakadabrien: Das magische Kartenspiel
boardgame.description: There's a lot going on in Abrakadabrien! Towers miraculously appear and collapse again, rivers swell and disappear again, forests grow and transform. 2-6 players are busy creating their magical landscapes in this card game. All players play simultaneously. They try to achieve the most goals with planning skill. Treasure, event and order cards also provide variety. The goal is to move one's territory back and forth, then transform it, earning points in the process.

boardgame.name: Tiere der Welt: Wissensreise durch die Wildnis
boardgame.description:
In this exciting puzzle game, children learn about the animals of the world. The players guess which animals are hidden behind the puzzle cards. In the process, they discover more and more animal characteristics and abilities. Players discover the different characteristics and abilities of the animals to figure out which animals are being searched for on the puzzle cards.

The puzzle cards in the game each depict four animals and four traits, with all traits always applying to only one of the animals depicted. At the beginning of the round, the traits are covered with a marker. A player can make a trait available to all or - once per game - to himself alone. Afterwards, players can make a guess as to which animal the already visible properties apply to. Once a player has guessed, the player is out for the round. After the fourth hint at the latest, everyone must have guessed. All players who have guessed correctly receive points according to the difficulty of the puzzle card and advance accordingly many spaces on a track. When a player has gone around the track once, the game ends and that player wins.

boardgame.name: A-Series Adventure Omnibus Volume 1
boardgame.description:
A-Series Adventure Omnibus

25 adventures spanning over 1,100 pages.

The complete collection of Adventureaweek.com's A-Series adventure modules

Note: The PDF file is the same for volumes 1 & 2 (all A-Series adventures are included in the PDF) but print files are different and contain half the adventures in the first volume book and the other half in the second volume.

boardgame.name: A Flote
Flotsam Float
In equilibrio nei mari del sud
Stapelgekte in de Zuiderzee
Südseestapelei
Trésors à la dérive
boardgame.description:
Skill is required in this game of island hopping. Flotsam Float contains 24 colorful stacking stones. This flotsam and jetsam must be collected and stacked on the wobbly raft. You need a steady hand because the fully loaded raft must be balanced to the next island.

In clockwise order, players pick a wooden piece and must stack it on one of the raft cards on top of the already existing found objects. In doing so, they must not move the other pieces. If no piece fell, that player may take an island card that has shells and a symbol on it. The symbol indicates which island the raft must be balanced to in the second phase. The islands are each four cards with a symbol on them, which are randomly distributed in the game area during the set-up. The raft card must be moved, but the found objects may not be touched. If again nothing has fallen down, this player gets the number of shells credited as points. The game is over as soon as only one island has island cards left. The player with the most shells wins.

listing.notes: Title: Stapelgekte in de Zuiderzee Publisher: Haba Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Pundit Games
boardgame.description:
Pundit is football’s original trivia game
Made for fans like ourselves, who love to revisit memories of legendary players and iconic moments!

Challenge friends and family to see who best remembers the forgotten greats,
cult heroes, one-hit wonders, fringe players and young prospects - to take the Pundit crown!


Easy to setup
Play 4+ friends
45 min. gametime
Easy & Hard dificulty
900 original Pundit questions


www.punditgames.com // @punditgames


QUICK START RULES - THE LAWS OF THE GAME
Start playing in 3 minutes by learning the basics.

1. Warm ups done. Choose five categories to compete in and flip a coin.
Place five selected categories into the five slots. Whichever team wins the coin toss
picks three categories, the losers pick two.





2. The Football starts with the skipper.
The attacking team keeps possession when answering correctly and then chooses to
either pass the ball up the pitch to their next player or draw a Tactic card.





3. Attackers score the goals.
If the attacking team answers a question correctly, while the ball is at the Forward’s
feet – a goal is scored. It’s also possible to score from the penalty spot via a Tactic card.





4. A match lasts 45 minutes.
When time is up, the team in possession can finish their attack for one last goal.
No Tactic cards allowed in stoppage time!

boardgame.name: Beyond the Beaten Track
boardgame.description:
One of your Agents has been dealing in the shadows and attracted the attention of the UIG. He needs to be brought back in and guess who's been chosen to find him.

Beyond the Beaten Track is a dangerous mission taking players around the world to the vicious badlands of Austalia. What starts off as an extraction takes a horrifying turn when the Freestate's less savoury residents become involved.

Beyond the Beaten Track is a survival-horror themed mission for any number of Agents and can be scaled to any level.

The mission contains exciting locations in the Freestate, new equipment and four NPCs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Sly'ne
boardgame.description:
In this puzzle game, players must align their four marbles in a straight to win.

Each turn, the participants must perform two actions among the following five:


Place a tile
Move a tile
Place a marble
Move a marble
Place a barricade


The game ends as soon as a player manages to align their four marbles in a straight uninterrupted line (without a barricade blocking the path).

The board is not fixed, the hexagons can be moved just like the marbles.
But be careful, the tides can quickly change and a simple mistake can lead you in a world of pain.

boardgame.name: Flavius Rule
boardgame.description:
Flavius Rule is a turn-based survival gladiatorial arena game for 4 players(1-8 for variants). Starting with a humble set of armors, weapons, and equipment, each player tries to advance their gladiator in several ways by battling vicious animals and spawned opponents, acquiring new armor and weapons, collecting precious gold, items, favor, or daringly drawing a card.

Summa Rudis, shrinking arena, floor spikes, NPCs, spectators, and more will hinder a player’s chance for success, however the most difficult challenge will be fighting each other to be the last remaining player. Will you be the last one standing? Will you be Crowned Victorious by Flavius Rule?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Corporation Report 2020
boardgame.description:
TO FIGHT THE CORPS YOU NEED TO KNOW THE CORPS

Corporation Report 2020 combines the classic Merill, Asukaga & Finch Corporation Reports 1 thru 3 and spills the dirt on six of the biggest Megacorps of the 2020 era:

Arasaka • International Electric • Lazarus •
Militech • Petrochem • SovOil

Read this book and you’ll know the score. Each report details a MegaCorp’s history, leaders, personnel, equipment, holdings, security, and standard operating procedures. If you live on the Edge and you want to survive, you need this book. After all, if you’re going to take on the Corps, you need to learn everything you can to avoid ending up at the
Bodybank with a tag on your toe.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Schollen treiben
boardgame.description:
The animals in the Arctic are bored. That's why polar bears, seals, ice gulls and even the odd orca have arranged to play a fun little game: floating on the ice floes.

So without further ado, the animals jump around happily on the ice floes and try to form the largest possible groups with conspecifics. The orcas help where they can and the other animals pass the time cheerfully in the icy Arctic Ocean.

In this fun card game by author Martin Schlegel, 2-6 people aged 8 and up must have good eyes.

In each round, the aim is to find the best possible place for the newly revealed card in order to form the largest possible groups of animals of the same species.

How is the game played?
At the beginning, 2 cards are placed in the middle, whereby it does not matter whether their islands fit together sensibly or not. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

Then turn over another card, place it in plain sight for everyone to see, and start a 1-minute countdown.

Now the "let the heads smoke" phase begins:

Which of you will find the best place for the new card? You should make sure that as many animals of the same species (polar bears, seals, ice gulls) as possible come together on the newly created floes.

If an orca can be seen on both maps, the points are doubled.

Within the 1-minute countdown, everyone now looks for the best place for the new map and you all note down the highest possible score.

At the end of the minute, you compare the numbers and whoever has the highest number of points has to prove that putting on the card also brings in the corresponding number of points.

If this is successful, the person receives 3 extra points in addition to the number of points he or she has written down; all others receive the number of points they have written down.

If this is not successful, the person goes away empty-handed; all the others receive their points and the card is discarded.

In the game instructions you will find 2 more variants: One where you outscore each other by calling out the scores, another with an hourglass. The scoring remains the same in both cases.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Mixture Mischief
boardgame.description:
In this cooperative game a group of young alchemists try to prepare potions before the ingredients run out. Players add ingredients - play different coloured cards into the cauldron. However, mischievous cats will cause a lot of trouble and can ruin the recipe.
The goal of the game is to prepare as many potions as possible, working together, adding ingredients, and repairing the mischief caused by the cats. The players have won if they prepare enough potions before the ingredients run out. The more they prepare, the better the final score.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mixture Mischief: Black Cat promo card

boardgame.name: Maszat és az elveszett plüssök
boardgame.description:
Maszat took a trip to the near forest and only at home he realised that his toys must have escaped while resting and snacking. They are lost. Help them find the way home before sunset or Tigriske the housecat will occupy their basket and they won’t have a place to rest.

This is a cooperative memory game in which you have to find the right tiles in the correct order to guide home the toys before Tigriske completes his track. In your turn you declare which tile you are looking for and if you flip the right one you move the toy closer. If the flipped tile is not the one you were looking for everyone tries to memorise it so you will remember where it is when it’s needed later. With each error Tigriske moves. You win if you guide home all the toys. If Tigriske gets back before the last toy he curls up in the basket leaving no space for the toys and you loose the game.

Based ont he Maszat book series by Judit Berg.

boardgame.name: Ironclads of the American Civil War
boardgame.description:
On March 9, 1862, the clash of the ironclad gunboats CSS Virginia and USS Monitor at the Battle of Hampton Roads heralded a new age of naval warfare. The innovations of the early industrial era yielded powerful new warships, armed with strong new guns, and plated with thick metal armor. A new ironclad navy threatened to revolutionize the practice of naval warfare, rendering old wooden fleets obsolete.
This solitaire book game explores the use of ironclads during the American Civil War through a series of scenarios that teach the system gradually. In seeking to capture essential qualities of the battles in a fast and playable system, many aspects of these conflicts have been abstracted. Simplicity and ease of play have taken precedence over intricate rules and historical detail.

Each scenario consists of a playsheet (left) and mapsheet (right), and features a short historical introduction. The scenarios, which each usually take 20 to 30 minutes to play, walk you through the rules. As you progress from scenario to scenario, new rules will be added, basic rules will be upgraded to ‘standard’ or ‘advanced’ status, and scenario-specific rules may come into play. By the end of the book, you’ll have experienced the game system in full, and perhaps something of ironclad history as well.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Menzacsata
boardgame.description:
Menzacsata sends you back to a typical Hungarian school canteen. You like it or not you cannot leave anything on your plate to go to waste, you have to eat it. The overly nice kitchen ladies keep the extra portions coming and your evil school mates try to get rid of their collection by tossing it on your food pile.

This is an easy to understand quick and fun card game. Each card has a color and a food on it. You start with three in your hand, no cards in your food pile, and one card in the common discard pile. The goal is to have less cards in your foodpile than the others when the deck runs out. In your turn you can play cards from your hand or your foodpile if the color or the food mathes the top card on the discard pile. You can continue playing cards until you don't have any that matches or you decide to stop. Kitchen staff, classmate and school pet action cards help you to get rid of your food pile, often by giving cards to other players.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 21)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 21 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: Slaughter on the Procyon Express
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover how a red-eye train ride became the Slaughter on the Procyon Express in this month's installment of Rimbound Transmission!

Try out an exciting zombie outbreak on a train inspired by classic survival horror!

boardgame.name: Exclusion Zone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Phonoi 1 was made uninhabitable 25 years ago. The evacuation was a rushed and painful operation. No signals have been sent from the planet in 23 years until now. A distress signal has been sent. No language just a solid tone.
The Arnell Corporation has thrown together an extraction team to locate the source of the distress signal and escort the survivors back to the drop ship.

A cosmic horror hex crawl as small as it is deadly for Mothership.

boardgame.name: Sheep in Disguise: Goblin Expansion
boardgame.description:
This destructive 33 card expansion adds even more depth and strategy to the original or NSFW edition of Sheep in Disguise! Includes tricky Traps, sneaky Actions, and Sheep with special abilities to spice up the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sheep in Disguise: Wizard Expansion
boardgame.description:
This enchanted 33 card expansion adds even more depth and strategy to the original or NSFW edition of Sheep in Disguise! Includes powerful Spells, magical Actions, and Sheep with special abilities to spice up the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sheep in Disguise: NSFW
boardgame.description:
Putting sheep in disguises to protect them from deadly predators seemed like a great idea... until we lost all the sheep. Now a new age is upon us! With demand soaring, sheep are worth their weight in gold! Build your Flock, build your fortune, and protect it all from predators and opponents alike. NSFW artwork on every card!

Sheep in Disguise is a vibrant and strategic card game about protecting adorably-helpless Sheep from being devoured by the many outrageous and dangerous predators of the world. Collect Flocks of Sheep, keep them safe from Attacks, and use Action cards to destroy anyone that gets in your way!

Players take turns drawing cards to collect matching sets of disguised Sheep and a variety of powerful Action cards. When a player has collected 3 Sheep of a kind, they must be placed face up on the table immediately. This set of 3 Sheep is called a Flock. In a 4 player game, the first person to collect 4 unique Flocks is the winner.

On their turn, a player may use as many Action cards as they like by playing them to the Discard. They may also make one trade with the Field per turn. The Field is a constantly changing group of cards in the middle of the table that players can exchange cards with to help them build a strong hand. The Field guarantees that the game isn’t completely luck of the draw and allows the player to strategize and build combo moves in order to progress their game.

Players can also target an opponent's Flock by placing an Expose card on top of it. This Action exposes the Flock's disguise, leaving them vulnerable to an Attack! Players must choose to take the risk of leaving their Flock exposed or pay to remove the Expose card, ensuring the Flock's identity remains a secret. When an Attack card is drawn, all Exposed Flocks are destroyed!

Be strategic and be devious. If you play your cards right, you can turn the Attack card into an extremely powerful tool to help you get ahead... otherwise, you may end up as the victim.

If you find yourself falling behind, don't worry! All players are in it until the very end and one big move is all it takes to flip the whole game on its head!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Book of Random Tables: Fantasy Shops
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Fantasy Shops for Your Players to Explore

Players will often want to explore cities as much as they want to explore the wilderness. Not only do shops offer goods and services for the player characters, but they can also be a valuable resource in handing out quests or building story hooks.

Twenty Shop Types with myriads of combinations: Armor, Barber, Books, Bowyer, Brewery, Divination, Fletcher, General Store, Macabre & Oddities, Magic Pets, Medicine, Music, Potions, Robes, Tack, Tailor, Toys & Tinkers, Wands, Weapons, and Writing Supplies.

Each shop has naming options plus special and mundane wares. Also, DMs or GMs can assume the shops have a selection of ordinary goods if desired. All are arranged in random tables, so they can be generated quickly.

Flesh out stores with Years in Business, Number of Employees, Shop Appearance tables, Person Descriptors tables, Desk and Storeroom tables, Shopkeeper Rumors, and a Secrets table.

Never tell your players there are no shops on the street. Use this resource to create a shop on the fly and populate your worlds with interesting items and non-player characters. Good luck and good shopping.

boardgame.name: Monasteries in Spain (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
A 12-tile fan expansion for Carcassonne centered around the rich cultural heritage of Spain. As the nation with the 3rd most UNESCO World Heritage sites (48, as of July 2019, behind Italy and China), Spain is rich in monasteries. This expansion gathers the most important ones, together with a new way of playing.

Similarly to other expansions consisting in monasteries, the player will be given the option to play them as a regular monastery by placing a monk or as a Spanish monastery by placing an abbot, simbolized by a meeple balanced on its side.

Special rules apply to the Spanish Monasteries, which score points for having features in the 8 surrounding tiles. The more features around it, the greater the score. But beware, the abbot and the scoring of the Spanish Monastery will only happen once those features are fully complete. Should things not go as you hoped, don't worry, you will still get some points on end-game scoring.

boardgame.name: Unique Locations: Collection 05

Whether encountered on a quest, or simply found while traveling from here to there, feel free to add these unique locations to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Locations include:

A demon trapped wihin the remains of a dungeon
Stone lintels making a doorway to - where? The land of Fae?
Good-aligned warriors and clerics benefit from praying in a tomb
The walls of a derelict wizard's tower fall away to reveal another building

Tharn, the Lost One
