boardgame.name: Shadowrun: Edge Zone
boardgame.description: Some of you likely remember the Shadowrun trading card game from back in the ’90s. Well, we’ve been updating the graphics, putting in some new art, tweaking a few game elements here and there, and getting it ready for re-release! It will come in two boxes, the Magic deck and the Machine deck, that lets you choose your area of emphasis. You can build two decks and get playing with either deck, or you can get both boxes to make your deck exactly the way you want it to be!

boardgame.name: ジャントリック (Juntrick)
boardgame.description:
Juntrick is a trick taking game using the theme of rock, paper, scissors. Players have to follow suit in playing a card. If all cards are of the same suit, the largest card win. If there is two suits, using rock, paper, scissors to determine the winning suit and the largest card wins. If all 3 suits are in the trick, the first-played smallest card wins.

It has a deck of 36 cards in suits from 1 to 12. Card 3, 6, and 9 has a bomb. Whoever collects a bomb will score -4 points at the end of a hand; otherwise, each card collected worths 1 point.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

boardgame.name: Slice & Dice
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.
Level up your dice, find powerful equipment for them. Try to defeat the boss at the end of the dungeon. If you lose a fight you'll have to start again, so be careful : )

- Free demo
- Simple turn-based combat
- 3d dice physics
- 60 hero classes
- 36 monsters
- 171 items
- A bunch of achievements and modes
- Online leaderboards

User Summary

Control a party of five characters each with their own die. Use these dice to defeat monsters, then upgrade your party with items and by upgrading them to different classes with different dice.

boardgame.name: Angry Indians
boardgame.description:
Welcome to India where we pack a lot of chaos into an uncomfortably little space. This happens to make a lot of us angry. Manage your hand, and create and destroy parties made of the most loved and unloved Indian stereotypes. Is your Babban Berozgaar being attacked? Block them with your Nimbu-Mirch Force Field! Jealous of somebody’s party? Kidnap their Termineta! Hell, gang-up your attacks and get violent! And always keep your Nunchak Chappals Handy! It’s like real life, only without real repercussions.

Setup:
Everybody starts with 3 randomly selected Member Cards, with each member having a starting health ranging from 3 to 5 and belonging to 1 of 8 classes, which are signified by colour. Everybody playing gets 5 Attack Cards for their hand (for their eyes only). The Attack Cards are what will be used by players during their turns to damage each others’ Party Members by matching class. There are also some Tactical Cards among the Attack Cards, such as trade, heal and block to add strategy to play.

Objective:
There are two modes to determine who wins:

Last Man Standing: The last player left with any number of members in their party with any amount of health.
First Knockout: The person with the highest Party health at the moment any one player’s entire party dies is the winner.


Gameplay:
During your turn you must play 2 actions. As an action you can either damage somebody else’s member, play a tactical card (among the Attack Cards) or discard and draw from an Attack Card draw pile in the centre.

boardgame.name: Hostil Hostal
boardgame.description:
You are a tourist guide and are responsible for a group of 4 tourists that have travelled to the mysterious sites of Rocky Valley. Unfortunately, a landslide has forbidden the return home and you will have to stay for a few days. The only inn in town is the legendary Hostil Hostal, renowned for an intriguing past and continuous deterioration.

You will have to struggle to accommodate your guests so they can rest through the night, or at least live through it.

In Hostil Hostal is a family, strategic but easy-entry game. Players take turns placing guests on the beds of the different rooms of the inn. Each room brings different levels of comfort that will change with its occupancy and wear. The guest’s rest is affected by different events that are played with cards in secret. In Hostil Hostal, slumber is represented by zZ. In the end, the player with the most zZ will be the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Unreachable Terror (5E)
boardgame.description:
For 4-6 PCs of 9th-10th level

This adventure is geared towards a party that includes a divine character such as a priest or paladin of good alignment. The devotee’s patron has summoned them, whether through visions or by missive from a high temple, to perform a holy gaes—a distant settlement bearing a sacred shrine to the deity is in dire need of aid from a dark curse that has befallen their home. Motivation to pursue completion of the quest can be either positive (the promise of favor or reward if accomplished), negative (revocation of holy magic if refused), or both; keeping in line with the personality of the specific deity.

Denizens of the island village of Unreach are being afflicted by a terrible disease (Demon Fever), and many have already died. The unknown source of this curse is a coven of three night hags (one in hiding among the villagers) who have taken to the remote island to enslave the souls of its stranded inhabitants—who are easy pickings when the few vessels that visit the isle can be weeks or months apart.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Spinner's Hole (5E)
boardgame.description:
For 4 Level 1 Characters

A lair long known for harboring giant spiders, this ancient dungeon is tolerated and periodically invaded for the valuable silk that is produced within. The local village of Spinner’s Folly have long since woven this silk into useful items, from light clothing to strong rope, but must retrieve the silk three times per year to maintain their supplies of this precious
commodity.

On these three special occasions, adventurers– especially those with rangers and druids within their ranks – are invited to enter the complex and subdue the spiders long enough for bales of raw silk to be gathered by the weavers. However, there are two provisions; none of the silk may be significantly damaged and the spiders may not be harmed during this harvest – the weavers do not wish to kill off their rich source of silk. Failure to do so certainly earns the enmity of the local population and forfeit any payment.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Palace of Ahmad Sahir (5E)
boardgame.description:
A 5E compatible adventure for 4 PCs of Level 6

Ahmad Sahir was a wizard of great renown, known for his devotion to Matan, Nar, and Shem, the three goddesses of divination and oases. After rescuing the goddesses from an unscrupulous sultan who bound them with foul magic, Sahir was gifted with a desert oasis. He commissioned a small palace to be built and devoted his life to the goddesses. Seeking revenge, the sultan cursed Sahir and when the wizard succumbed to madness, the goddesses withdrew from him.

Sahir began to believe he must bind the goddesses as the sultan did to regain their blessings. He began sacrificing his servants and using their blood in his evil rite, but he needed royal blood to complete it. He invited Jamila Amire, his cousin and a princess, to visit him. Amire accepted the invitation and has not been seen since. Now her father has sent the PCs to investigate.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: With a Candlestick (5E)
boardgame.description:
A 5E compatible adventure for 4 PCs of Levels 3-5

Lord and Lady Scarlet are wealthy, well connected and generally well liked - for nobility. Their social talents have lead to them hosting a national embassy on their estate, which now see a constant exchange of visiting nobility of all stripes. As one of the most well connected people in politics, Lord Scarlet is a perfect person to ask for a favor that requires political clout: which is why the PCs are paying him a visit. Yet they arrive at an unfortunate time. Mere minutes ago, Lord Scarlet was found dead in the library of his own embassy, in the middle of hosting a small group of business partners to discuss an upcoming venture.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Unquenched Thirst (5E)
boardgame.description:
A 5E compatible adventure for 4-5 PCs of Level 3

The tiny isle of Sandspit is a favorite place to maroon recalcitrant shipmates, for across the bay, the headland falls are visible to castaways. Wicked currents prevent escape from Sandspit, and the unfortunates discarded there slowly die of thirst in sight of the lifegiving waters. One such piece of tortured flotsam was Captain Staid Merrik, who rose as a wight and walked under the currents to reach the cup of life long denied. The foul magic of undeath clinging to Merrik ripped the sustenance out of the waters at the base of the falls, and as long as Merrik’s shade resides in a cave behind them, will continue to do so, to the detriment of creatures native to the headland, or watering parties from passing vessels.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Cackling Madness of Umberstone Manor (5E)
boardgame.description:
A 5E compatible adventure for 3-4 PCs of Levels 13-15

Lingering in the shadow of Mount Shalefor, Umberstone Manor is the ancestral home of the Valninboom family. The mansion is set high upon Umberstone Hill on the outskirts of the city of White Oak’s Shire. The settlement was founded three centuries past when the progenitor of the Valninbooms, Lord Rimbrall, first incorporated it as a base of operation for the White Oak Trading Company.

Renowned dealers of antiquities, the Valninbooms’ trade empire amassed great wealth as masters to the River Wyde. Over the centuries the simple trade outpost grew in population and eventually bore its own thriving economy. Today the city is a bustling trade port. The generations of Valninbooms grew in wealth and power, but they also became reclusive. The Valninbooms focus on company business, and rarely make public appearances.

As the outpost expanded, those who held administrative positions in the trading company soon inherited governing responsibilities for the city. These positions of power in White Oak’s Shire are passed down through generations forming several influential houses within the community. No one interacts directly with the Valninbooms save for the council of governors who each head one of the five houses of White Oak.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Hentai Cool Girls
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap tile puzzle of 40 levels with girls in various occupations.

boardgame.name: Rolls and Girls
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap tile puzzle of 40 levels with girls in various occupations.

boardgame.name: Symbaroum Adventure Collection
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
The Symbaroum Adventure Collection assembles the content of three previously published products, featuring six adventures that demonstrate what different kinds of stories that may play out in the game world – forest expeditions, excavations of ancient ruins, political intrigues, even witch hunts and murder mysteries. So turn down the light, make the world around you disappear, and get ready to enter the wondrous world of Symbaroum.

boardgame.name: The House of Wisdom
boardgame.description:
A lightly competitive research collecting and discovery making card game of shared progress.

You are scholars at the Baghdad House of Wisdom during the Islamic Golden Age. Starting with only a few Classical translations and the aid of a handful of great Scholars you will gather Research to make incredible Discoveries that will shape the world for the next thousand years. Each discovery expands the possibilities for all players to make even greater discoveries and awards you with Prestige that will ultimately mark you as one of the world’s greatest scientists and thinkers.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: M.E.A.T.: The Cult
boardgame.description:
M.E.A.T.: The Cult is a card and board game in which the most important mechanics are: drawing, drafting and playing cards. Significant elements of the game are also: selecting tactics, in which players decide on the arrangement of cards, the order and type of plays, as well as randomness - random selection of cards and the use of dice rolls in the game.

The main goal of the game is to bring the opponent's (or the opposing group's) VITALITY points to 0. This process is possible due to the advantage achieved in subsequent game rounds.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Planet Voyagers
boardgame.description: Each player manages a hand of five cards. Each round, players simultaneously play one card from their hand. The cards are revealed and resolved. Players earn points from the cards in different ways --- by moving their rockets across the solar system; by researching planets; or by receiving the points shown on the cards themselves. Hands are replenished at the end of the round. The first player to reach Neptune or to earn 12 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Carrera de Palabras
boardgame.description:
CARRERA DE PALABRAS ES UN JUEGO PARA 2 a 4 JUGADORES DONDE SE VA A PONER A PRUEBA TU VELOCIDAD Y VOCABULARIO.

¡SÉ EL MÁS RÁPIDO!
Descarta primero tus pilones de sílabas, formando palabras con las sílabas del centro. En este juego los jugadores deben intentar ser los primeros en descartar todas sus tarjetas de sílabas. ¿La regla? Armar palabras con otras sílabas disponibles. Un juego para pensadores dinámicos.
Partidas rápidas para entrenar nuestro diccionario interno y nuestra agilidad mental.

PENSAMIENTO DIVERSO
Incluye cartas de imágenes que te obligan a pensar de otra manera; combinando diferentes destrezas mentales y formas de pensamiento.

---

WORD RACE IS A GAME FOR 2 TO 4 PLAYERS WHERE YOUR SPEED AND VOCABULARY WILL BE TESTED.

BE THE FASTEST!
Discard your piles of syllables first, making words with the syllables in the center. In this game, players must try to be the first to discard all of their syllable cards. Rule? Make words with other available syllables. A game for dynamic thinkers.
Quick games to train our internal dictionary and our mental agility.

DIVERSE THINKING
Includes picture cards that force you to think differently; combining different mental skills and ways of thinking.

boardgame.name: Signum
boardgame.description:
Signum is a drawless connection game for the hexhex board in the vein of Global Connection, but without markings on the board or an initial position.

Play: Players take turns placing one stone of their color on any empty hex.

Goal: When the board is full, the game is over and the player with the higher score is the winner.

Scoring: Each stone is worth 1 point for its owner if it is part of a group connecting opposite sides of the board, and -1 point otherwise.

The pie rule is used to balance the game: One player decides what the first move is, and the other player decides whether to play first or second.

The titular scoring trick that ensures there are no ties (each stone is either worth +1 or -1 points) was (unbeknownst to the inventor of Signum) discovered by the inventor of Loops 9 years earlier. That game expresses it even better: Stones that are not worth a point for their owner is worth a point for their opponent.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ghost Writer
boardgame.description:
An Angry Ghost Will Be Denied Credit No Longer!

A lost tale from the Bard resurfaces, but it produces not only a play but also a vengeful ghost!

The clock is ticking as the intrepid globetrotters try to discover why this apparition haunts and kills those involved. If they don’t solve the mystery quickly, then the globetrotters may count themselves amongst the victims!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Arcane Invitation
boardgame.description:
Arcane Invitation is a toolbox for running academic adventures using 5th edition of Dungeons & Dragons as a core mechanic. You and your friends create kid characters, ready to take on the magical world through the lens of their educational experience. The DM adapts our curriculum of classes, professors, and mysteries into a campaign that brings out the best in your young heroes.

In this tome you’ll find all the classes, feats, backgrounds, spells, magical items and more that will bring your burgeoning spellcaster to life. We provide rules for wands (or orbs, rods, or staves) that choose the wizard, puzzles and tests, schoolyard fights, arcane athleticism, social status, mysteries on the school grounds, vindictive or inspirational professors, and more. The mechanics of Arcane Invitation encompass the usual physical encounters, as well as the mental and social battles that take place at places of learning.

While the usual D&D races can be used with Arcane Invitation, the corebook also provides a system for designing school Houses to fill that role for a character. Each House aspires to certain virtues (or vices), which they impress upon their members. Houses are a great way to bind characters together, make them into rivals, or just give them a social hierarchy to navigate. Entire campaigns might plumb the depths of a House’s origins and secrets, or explore the idiosyncrasies of its members.

Arcane Invitation is a D&D adaptation, not a campaign setting. It’s a toolbox and a starting place for building your own campaigns. Heavily inspired by hit books and films set in magical boarding schools, it’s designed to bridge the gap between our favorite young adult fiction settings and our favorite fantasy roleplaying system. It’s whimsical and magical, but artistically and thematically focused on real life. Artwork in Arcane Invitation is made from turning real photos into seemingly arcane situations.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Adventures in the Underbelly
boardgame.description:
This is a supplement for Starguild: Space Opera Noir and requires those core rules.

Behind the clean and tidy facade of the Core worlds lies an open secret that nobody talks about. Living under the rule of tooth and claw, of criminal gangs and desperate holds where no official eye is watching, secrets are unfurling.

With a population desperate to escape and willing to take any chance to achieve personal power or win a better life for their families, illegal research into cybernetics and psionics is taking place. Funded mostly by barons and lords who are attempting something off the books, or cruel syndicates who just don’t care, organisations with an agenda are attempting to bend and break the laws of nature.

This supplement includes expanded rules for cybernetics and a variety of psionic powers, with calibration settings depending upon whether you like these elements to be gritty, noir or pulp – and the personal penalties which someone may bear for experimenting with them.

It also includes much more detail about the Cybercops, the Psicops, and enemy organisations such as Protocol-19 and Provolution. There is also a series of scalable NPC foes who have been dabbling in either of those forbidden areas.

Finally, you will find a short series of three linked adventures relating to a cybernetic threat and another three about a psionics conspiracy.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten
boardgame.description:
"Hello gardeners, I am a kitten - The Cheshire Kitten! I love to frolic in a variety of shrubs. Can you plant my dream garden?"

In Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten the Cheshire Kitten joins the magical world of Paint the Roses looking to play in shrubs with diverse colors and shapes. In this promo, you will get be able to advance the gardeners up to six spaces forward if you can create specific lines of colors and shapes the Cheshire Kitten desires.

This was a promo released for those who were a part of the early campaign email sign-up for the Paint the Roses Kickstarter Campaign.

boardgame.name: Jalopy Derby
boardgame.description:
Players bid, simultaneously, to race their Jalopies around the Checkpoint and back but beware: duplicated bids mean those jalopies take must take damage - and the more damage a jalopy takes, the slower it can move! However, guiding those jalopies are a variety of drivers each with their own special ability: let the fast-paced shenanigans commence!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Frog Princess
boardgame.description:
Players are Princesses who have been turned into frogs and must catch the juiciest flies and kiss the Prince to remove their curse.

Each round, the cloud of flies is positioned away from the lily pad - where the frogs have gathered - and the players must quickly guess how far away (in matchstick lengths) the flies are away: the player(s) who guess closest to the correct distance extend their reach toward the Prince - the first player to reach the Prince by accurate distance guessing is the winner.

This game is an homage to the fabulous Froschkonig by Zoch.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness 2: Ingenious Shield Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A promo card that came with all-in sleeves.

The Ingenious shield can be used together with a two-handed weapon.

boardgame.name: Fou Fou Fou!: Je reviendrai
boardgame.description: A new card for Fou Fou Fou!. At the end of his turn the player must shout "I Will Be Back".

boardgame.name: Fou Fou Fou! PnP
boardgame.description: 28 new cards for print and add to the base game.

boardgame.name: The 7th Continent: Companion App
boardgame.description:
The 7th Continent application is a free “companion app” – you must own The 7th Continent board game to put some of its features to good use. Use this app to listen to the game’s original soundtrack depending on the area you are exploring in the game.

If you find the “All-Seeing Eye” during your adventure, enjoy the augmented reality feature by scanning the game’s Terrain cards with your smartphone.

The 7th Continent is an adventure and exploration game by Ludovic Roudy and Bruno Sautter, for 1 to 4 players, published by Serious Poulp.

- description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Codenames: Codenames Gadget
boardgame.description:
Official support app for the Codenames board game. The app provides a random key generator and also an optional timer with sound alerts.

- description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Zombomination
boardgame.description:
Zombomination is an intense, post-apocalyptic, real-time or turn-based dice-rolling game that pits hardened Humans vs hungry Zombies. Asymmetrical roll options create intense action and unique strategies for each end-of-the-world faction. Zombies and Humans also have multiple, and different, winning conditions to make each game an exciting experience that feels new. Do you have what it takes to win?

Humans attempt to destroy the laboratory or find enough supplies to win. Zombies either attempt to kill all humans or overwhelm the safehouse to win. Depending on preference, players can engage in hectic real-time action or more strategic turn-based action. Both zombies and Humans take actions when 7's or doubles show on two rolled D6. Most real-time games play in less than 5 minutes. Turn-based games take about 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Gamma-Sigma 12 Report
boardgame.description:
From the publisher blurb:

"Well, this doesn’t sound good. Listen to this message we received.

“Is anyone out there? This is Resource Station Gamma-Sigma 12, we are under attack from a life form…

(static)

Our escape ships have launched only half-filled – cowards! - and there are no vessels left here to get us off the station – there are about twenty of us here and we’re scattered all over, requesting…

(static, crashing sounds, an inhuman screech)

Ben! Ben, they’re through! Get the gun! Patricia, take this and get ready! They’re through!

(screech)

Just shoot! Fire! Fire!

(gunshots, screeching, a cry of pain)

Dan, no! Keep firing! Keep…

(static, transmission ends)”

The nearest warship is two weeks out – you’re six days away on your route. We’re sending you as an advance team to get on board and secure and extract civilians before the big guns show up because Resource Station Gamma-Sigma 12 sent that mayday on every channel available, unencrypted, to make sure someone heard. That means any other company or private enterprise could be on their way there right now to claim the station and take the Calium-3 for themselves. So time is of the absolute essence.

Review the information included, including the station layout and statistics. We don’t know the condition of the station, who is there or what the threat is so go in hot...

... and expect trouble."

boardgame.name: Confederates of the Shattered Zone (Starfinder)
boardgame.description:
A Beacon of Hope in a Shattered World

Seeking four mysterious gates that could be the key to returning to their own world, your heroes dive into the dangerous asteroid colonies of the Shattered Zone. The polluted mines and hurtling planetoids are deadly on their own, but the infighting of the Zone's fractious factions is even more so, from the sadistic Contraptors to the fanatical soldiers of Purity, where factions and their adherents rise and fall and morality runs from gray to black. The PCs must navigate a broken world of deceit, moral compromise, and necessary sacrifices amid a grimy cybernetic dystopia, and all the while an ancient horror reaches from beyond the fourfold gates, waiting for those with the touch of destiny to come and set it free. There are secrets of the Patrons at stake, and the rewards are great, but only if the heroes can survive the deadly intrigues of the Confederates of the Shattered Zone.

Confederates of the Shattered Zone is an adventure for 11th to 14th level characters using the Starfinder Roleplaying Game. The latest chapter in the amazing Legendary Planet Adventure Path, a spectacular sword-and-planet saga from Legendary Games blending sci-fi and fantasy, magic and machine with an exciting pulp sensibility and style. Confederates of the Shattered Zone includes not only a massive interplanetary adventure but also brand-new monsters, magic, and technology, including new character options for cybernetic augmentations, along with a full gazetteer of the Shattered Zone and its inhabitants and an ongoing fiction series. Here you will find amazing adventures that span the stars and plunder the planets in a campaign that takes your heroes to 20th level and beyond! Grab this exotic epic today and Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: HYPERLANES: Foes Deck
boardgame.description:
HYPERLANES is the gaming technology that takes you there. We begin with all new Classes and Archetypes, reverse engineered from the basic building blocks of the D&D Player’s Handbook, but reprogrammed for scifi adventuring among the stars, integrating starship battle abilities from the ground up. We splice in all new Feats for cinematic action, systems for building alien species and robot chassis as Races, and iconic Backgrounds to add dimensionality to your spacer.

This is the Foes deck. This 50 card deck includes all of the potential enemies and ferocious monsters presented in the HYPERLANES corebook, generated using our own easy-to-use template system. Just what's needed to keep your game fast, action-packed, and cinematic.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: HYPERLANES: Vehicles Deck
boardgame.description:
YPERLANES is the gaming technology that takes you there. We begin with all new Classes and Archetypes, reverse engineered from the basic building blocks of the D&D Player’s Handbook, but reprogrammed for scifi adventuring among the stars, integrating starship battle abilities from the ground up. We splice in all new Feats for cinematic action, systems for building alien species and robot chassis as Races, and iconic Backgrounds to add dimensionality to your spacer.

This is the Vehicles deck. This 49 card deck includes all of the vehicles presented in the HYPERLANES corebook, generated using our own easy-to-use template system. Just what's needed to keep your game fast, action-packed, and cinematic.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: 적룡객잔 딜럭스 (The Red Dragon Inn Deluxe)
boardgame.description:
Korean deluxe edition of Red Dragon Inn. Includes all 12 characters of Red Dragon Inn 1,2,3.

- 1 : Deirdre the Priestess, Fiona the Volatile, Gerki the Sneak, and Zot the Wizard
- 2 : Dimli the Dwarf, Eve the Illusionist, Fleck the Bard, Gog the Half-Ogre
- 3 : Wizgille the Tinkerer, Brewmaster Phrenk, Kaylin the Renegade, Serena the Pious

In Red Dragon Inn, you and your friends are a party of heroic, fantasy adventurers. You've raided the dungeon, killed the monsters, and taken their treasure. Now you're back, and what better way to celebrate your most recent victory than to spend an evening at the Red Dragon Inn. You and your adventuring companions will spend the night drinking, gambling, and roughhousing. The last person who is both sober enough to remain conscious and shrewd enough to hold onto his Gold Coins wins the game.

boardgame.name: Tomato!
boardgame.description:
Throw your cards in the vegetables! Why? Why not?! Open the tomato, shuffle the cards, deal and off you go! TOMATO contains over 80 numbered cards from 1 to 10, which must be thrown into the open tomato in the correct order. Correct sequence? The rules are very simple: if the number on one of your cards is one higher or one lower than the top number on the discard pile, then you may discard it. The sequence 1 – 2 – 3 – 2 – 3 – 4 would be perfect! Easy right? Just always +1 or -1. All other differences are not allowed. But you have to be careful, because everyone is throwing wildly at the same time. And who wins? The first player to get rid of their hand cards wins. Understood? Then off to the vegetables!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: The James O'Brien Mystery Hour Game
boardgame.description:
The informative, witty, conversational, argumentative game, based on James O’Brien’s Mystery Hour on LBC Radio.

One player acts as the ‘Host’ and asks the trivia questions. Other players have to write their answers on their answer pad, or if they’re not able to do this, they can choose one of the two answers now given by the host. One true, and one false. The host can also choose their own false answer if they please.

Any player getting the correct answer without choosing the one given by the host gets 3 points, any correct answer from the Host’s choices gets 1 point. If players instead choose the wrong answer from the Host, the host gets 2 points.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end, OR the player who reaches 35 points on the score track before all questions are answered.

boardgame.name: Project: BIOME
boardgame.description:
You will manage your own ecosystem in limited resource condition to beat the others. Beside that you will get to know our nature life such as animals, plant, and microbes better and see how beauty of them.

You will receive a card that represent the nature lives. Use them wisely to survive the last one and get your victory of Project: BIOME.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kashi
boardgame.description:
In Kashi, each player uses members of various ganas to build temples to lure lord Shiva back to the city.

The game plays out on a small game board representing the map of city Kashi and its temples. On their turn, a player may discard a virtue card to move to the corresponding zone, place a card on the region they are currently located, build a temple by having the favour of the ganas. Together they work to get Lord Shiva back to Kashi.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cavity
boardgame.description:
Cavity is a finite Go variant with an elimination goal – a bit like Mark Steere's Redstone, but without red stones.

Like Go, Cavity is played on the points of a square grid, and groups and liberties are defined the same way.
An empty region is a group of empty points, and it is said to be adjacent to a stone if any of its points are.

Setup:
Starting with Black, place one stone each on any empty point.
The setup is over as soon as the players have one stone each on the board.

Play:
On your turn, place a stone of your color on any point in an empty region that's adjacent to a stone of your color.
After placement, first remove all enemy groups that have no liberties, then remove all friendly groups that have no liberties.
In this phase, as soon as one player is the only one with stones on the board, the game is over and that player is the winner.

The game is balanced with the pie rule, or with pass-komi. Pass-komi is a whole number of points awarded to White as compensation for going second. White can spend such a point instead of placing a stone.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Paintbucket
boardgame.description:
Paintbucket is a flipping game of elimination for two players, White and Black. The game was designed by Michael Amundsen and Alek Erickson in 2022.

DEFINITION: A group is a maximal set of orthogonally adjacent like-colored pieces.

SETUP: Set up a chessboard using Reversi pieces in a checkered pattern.

GAMEPLAY: On your turn, flip an enemy group.

OBJECTIVE: Eliminate the enemy pieces.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Stalemate
boardgame.description:
Stalemate is a unique set of miniatures rules which captures the true flavor of World War I trench warfare. Within this game system are elements as; hand-to-hand fighting, artillery vectors, machine-guns, flanking maneuvers, and much more. It is the sincere hope of the authors that you derive many hours of enjoyment from this publication.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Złap mnie! Gra przygodowa
boardgame.description:
Tom has been trying to catch Jerry all day, will he finally succeed? …
Try and check, how easy is it to catch this smart and fast mouse!
Tom and Jerry. Catch me ! This is a simple game for the little ones, the children have to match the tokens with the right colors, to catch the mouse and win the game.
Playing in a friendly way teaches cheerful competition and develops logical thinking and insight.

boardgame.name: Monster Zone
boardgame.description:
Monster Zone is a card game that’s based off of luck, strategy and skill. Each player will have a deck of monsters, spells and traps and both will battle until all life points are depleted are depleted which is a lot harder then you think.

The core of this game are the dice and defense points. The defense points protect the player from taking full damage from defense monsters, keeping the player in the game longer. While the dice are used to use the effects of most of the cards In the game.

It’s a fun strategy card game that can be hours of fun and entertainment!

boardgame.name: Quivit!: The Color Matching Card Game
boardgame.description:
Quivit is a simple and fun grid-based card game playable on any surface. Cards are arranged in a 5 x 5 grid with players rotating cards with random color squares to match adjoining cards with like colors to score points. Numerous optional rules are included to make Quivit competitive for all age levels.

Quivit the color matching card game is quick and easy to learn. 2-5 players take turns rotating cards to link colors, scoring the most points possible.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – The Exiled Dead
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
- A warband expansion for Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, featuring seven morbid miniatures
- Includes a complete Rivals deck for out-of-the-box play and customization
- Contains over 70 cards, including 20 universal cards and 12 Grand Alliance cards for use by multiple warbands

The vampire Deintalos dwells in the darkness of Harrowdeep – a lurking menace eager to snare those who walk its labyrinthine passages. His experiences with the Force Dynamic – the arcano-electric force he believes animates all things – led to his self-imposed exile from Shyish, where his brand of necromancy is taboo. In Harrowdeep, Deintalos found an ideal place to hide his grisly experiments, aided by his mortal apprentice in necromancy, Marcov. Deintalos animates recovered cadavers with arcane machinery and the Force Dynamic. These Arcwalkers, as Deintalos dubs them, act in eerie unison to tear apart their foes. With their mindless assistance, Deintalos means to dissect every secret of the abyssal labyrinth in which he dwells.

The Exiled Dead are aggressive, but flexible enough to keep your opponents on their toes and play for objectives. Once you get your shambling fighters into a good position, they’ll be tough to tackle. To this end, Deintalos has an ability that will keep them all moving, activating multiple Arcwalkers at once. This box includes a complete Rivals deck, plus loads of extra cards allowing you to try out a few tricks, as well as universal cards and Grand Alliance cards to use with your other warbands.

This set contains:

- 7x push-fit Exiled Dead miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in a cadaverous grey to stand out even when unpainted
- 7x fighter cards, one for each warrior in the warband – Deintalos the Exile, the Prentice Markov, the Deadwalker Regulus, and the Arcwalkers Vlash, Bault, Coyl, and Ione.
- 65 cards to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, including:
– 12x Exiled Dead objective cards
– 10x Exiled Dead upgrade cards
– 10x Exiled Dead gambit spell and ploy cards
– 6x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
– 12x Grand Alliance cards, usable by any warband belonging to the specified Grand Alliance
– 1x Exiled Dead Warband Background / Rivals Deck Card

boardgame.name: Taphonomy: Dead or Fossilized
boardgame.description:
Through competitive play, game players learn about taphonomy (i.e., processes that affect an organism as it fossilizes). They explore how the organism’s biology, the environment it was deposited in, the physical and chemical changes during burial and decomposition, as well as discovery biases, can influence whether or not an organism is collected. Players attempt to preserve the best fossil collection by “time traveling” to the Jurassic; there they protect their specimens from taphonomic factors (either from random environmental events or other players) and learn what processes enhance or diminish preservation. Players then return to the present to recover their specimens and learn that collection issues can also bias sample recovery.

Developed by former Ph.D. student, Anna Weiss, and Dr. Rowan Martindale at The Jackson School of Geosciences at The University of Texas at Austin, play this educational board game at your favorite game night or as an educational tool in your classroom! The game can be played with 2-4 people (or more if you playing teams) and is fun for ages 12+!

Want to use this game in your high school or college classroom? Check out the Activity Description on the SERC "Teach The Earth" webpage; the board game is part of their "Exemplary Activities Collection".
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The Board of Regents of The University of Texas System

boardgame.name: Hockey Score
boardgame.description:
A card-based game wherein two teams (2 or 4 players) play cards out of their hand trying to clear the board and score goals across three periods. The scorepad allows best-of-seven series of games.

—user summary

listing.notes: Very good condition, would be about $20 to ship from Ottawa - though of course if you don't want the outer box it'd be about $6 to ship lol...one of those games.

boardgame.name: Naughty R18 Cards
boardgame.description:
These naughty cards are designed just for the dirtiest little F*****s out there and they are definitely not suitable for all the Karens out there. The questions in these cards will shock even the kinkiest players.

GAME PREPARATIONS:
Mix the deck and deal paper and pens to all players. The youngest player starts and the game continues clockwise. The active player draws the top card of the deck and proceeds according to the category rules. Used cards are placed under the deck.

Winner is the one who reaches 15 points first. If two or more players reaches 15 points in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

Cards are well suited for bachelor parties, Christmas parties and wild get-togethers with friends. Naughty R18 cards can also be used separately without the main game

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Handy Brawl
boardgame.description:
Handy Brawl - an epic, solo, print and play, in-hand card management game.


Fully deterministic - shuffle once during setup and the rest is up to you (although I can't predict more than 5 moves)!
Great replayability - lots of possible openings for the same monster-hero pairs. If you're bored, change your Hero, Monster or both and have a completely different experience!
Minimal requirements, great depth - each playthrough features only 9 card, but those 9 cards will give you a headache!
No dexterity elements required - all you need to do is keep 9 cards in a stack, so as they don't fall on the ground, bonus points for being able to fan them!
Well-thought saving mechanism - just stop at any time and put the cards as they are in your pocket or wallet!
Quick - a single game can take you as little as 5 minutes (if you don't want to win)!
Great graphics design and arts (non-existent yet)!
Story-rich - break skulls, set traps and kill powerful foes. Personal experience depends on your (lack) of imagination!
Designed with heart - heart of vampire pierced with an aspen stake!


—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stack'n Stuff: A Patchwork Game
boardgame.description:
In Stack'n Stuff, a more streamlined version of Patchwork, players are on the move. However, packing all of your stuff into a moving truck is quite tricky, costly, and time consuming — and the day runs out fast!

During the game, the last player on the time track chooses one of the next three furniture items. After paying the transportation cost and spending the loading time, the player places the patch on their truck game board. Whoever manages to pack their truck best, as well as earns the most money during the game, is a moving master and wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dual Dragon (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description: A new White Dragon is scaring Carcassonne. Play with 2 Dragons (a Red and a White one) that can both move and eat meeples during their path. The player who places the Dragon Tile decided which Dragon will move.

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods
boardgame.description:
This expansion features three new fighters from this world: Volhv, Zimorodok, and The Drowned Warrior. Each fighter brings new abilities to the worlds of Gatefall, and this team is a lot of fun to play.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Danika & Iva
Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Leshiy
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Swamp Zombies

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Component Tray
boardgame.description: Upgraded components tray for Gatefall.

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Leshiy
boardgame.description:
Leshiy is the gnome of the woods, the shepherd of trees and plants, but he will join any side that has the coin to pay. Those that encounter him find that his allies are the woods themselves and that they are held fast and their fate is sealed...

A new character for Gatefall.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Danika & Iva
boardgame.description:
The woods are enchanted, so the common folk say, but the most deeply enchanted part of the woods is the maze of hedges where the sorceress Danika and her familiar, Iva dwell. They say the hedges shift and move and devour those who enter them, and that those who try to hurt Danika soon find Iva there to protect her...

A new character for Gatefall.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods

boardgame.name: Nie puść Pawia!
boardgame.description:
Players meet to drink "lemonade" and to play this fun party game.
This is a party card game in which players take turns to play cards full of interaction between them. Each player has to play one card during their turn, after the card is played, players perform the action mentioned on the cards: swapping, drawing or discarding the cards etc.
There are no winners in this game - only one loser. The loser is the player who was forced to play the "Puściłeś pawia" card. The game ends after one of the players plays this card.
The game is humorous, and fun to play during the party.

boardgame.name: Biomos
boardgame.description:
Biomos is a fast family game where you embody a planet. Over millions of years you grow to realize your dream: to harbor life on beautiful landscapes.

Players take turns drafting land tokens (sea, ice, forest, mountain and desert) choosing where to put it on their planet board. By completing one of the pattern available before the others, they can claim the corresponding biome card and have life appears on their planet.

The winner is the player with the most different species on its planet when they are all complete.

boardgame.name: Heroes - Volume I, Number 1
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

In this Issue:
Runequest
What's new for RuneQuest
Greg Stafford's History of the Lunar Empire

Powers & Perils
Travels Through Donara

Lords of Creation
"Survival Run of the Starnomads"

ETCETERA
News from the World
Dune Scenario
Telengard Review
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: Heroes, Volume I, Number 3
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Creation: the James Bond 007 game
Creatures: additional nasties to RuneQUest
Champions: the meanest fighters in the Western Lands
Characters: more aliens for Lords of Creation
Compilation: the complete index to Glorantha
Comic Opera: in roleplaying?
Curiosity: Why is this man smiling?
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: Heroes, Volume I, Number 4
boardgame.description: Volume I, Number 4
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: Heroes, Volume I, Number 5
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Turn of a Friendly Card adds gambling rules to Bond... 'Sprechen Sie Deutsch, Herr Bond' teaches secret agents foreign languages... The Devices of Oom and The Laws of Magics reveals new ways to handle magic items... A RuneQuest Gambling System makes betting a sure thing... There's more heroes and thugs for Lords of Creation, answers to Runequestions, and a city for Powers & Perilers in the Vth issue of HEROES.
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: HEROES, Volume I, Number 6
boardgame.description: Volume I, Number 6
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: HEROES, Volume II, Number 1
boardgame.description: Volume II, Number 1
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: HEROES, Volume II, Number 2
boardgame.description: Volume II, Number 2
boardgame.rpgissue: Avalon Hill's HEROES - The Role-Playing Magazine

boardgame.name: Pipo
boardgame.description: Pipo is an Alien party game for all Occasions! Simply play your Alien card and set and instruction based on the aliens features for the next player to match and then set their own. Quick, easy and for all ages, that's why its great for parties.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)
boardgame.boardgamedeveloper: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)

boardgame.name: Mushroom Cats!
boardgame.description:
Mushroom Cats! is an adorable card game about a mushroom hunt gone awry. Players compete to gather, steal, and magically transmute the most valuable collection of mushrooms they can before the picking is done and a winner is declared.

A clowder of cats has descended on your mushroom foraging trip, causing no end of mayhem. Your goal is simple: harvest the best basket of mushrooms you can find before the day is up, but watch out! These cats are behaving very strangely, and might steal or enchant your mushrooms!

Collect the most points to win.

The rules of Mushroom Cats! are quite simple, and players familiar with other pick-and-pass type games will have no trouble learning the rules. At the start of each round, players are dealt a hand of cards, then:


Simultaneously select and reveal a card
Resolve any special action cards that were played
Pass their hands to the next player and select a new card, continuing until all cards are played


Once a round is complete, players total their score from their played cards to determine a winner. That's it!

boardgame.name: Poronchan No Magical Lesson
ポロンちゃんのマジカルレッスン (Poron's Magical Lesson)
boardgame.description:
ポロンちゃんのマジカルレッスン (Poronchan No Magical Lesson) is a memory game from Japan.

Poron is teaching you magic. You learn various magical spells, Fire, Stone, Wind, during Poron's Magical lesson. Each spell that Poron demonstrates on the cards has a colour combination, yellow, red green and so on.

Players are shown a number of cards face up, and given time to memorise them. Then the cards are turned face-down, but the order is not changed. A new Poron card is dealt up, and the players must identify which hidden cards have which colours.

If a player can correctly recall the hidden spell, and determine if it matches the new spell at all, they gain points. But if they make mistakes, they lose points.

The player at the end with the most points is the best student and wins the game.
user summary

boardgame.name: All Stars Playlist
boardgame.description:
Whether you are a DJ at a party or you just want to listen to some music in your pajamas, you can always use a good playlist in each situation. In All Stars Playlist it is all about music and making the perfect playlist. Songs in a playlist of course have to match. You cannot just add any song to a playlist.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Create the perfect playlist by putting songs in your playlist that match with each other.

boardgame.name: Squadron Leader
boardgame.description:
Squadron Leader is a fast pace World War 1 (loosely) themed aerial combat game that is easy to learn and quick to play, with multifaceted strategy built in that can be enjoyed by all ages!

The modular nature of the rules allows for players to customise their game and add entirely new layers of strategy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hush: Mellowvalley
boardgame.description:
April 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Mellowvalley
Character card: Otto Copperbelly
Nocturnal Creature card: Cole Wakefield
Spirit card: Snake Spirit
Structures card: Tent/Scarecrow

boardgame.name: Thornraver: Battle of Solus
boardgame.description: Thornraver: Battle for Solus is a two player (3 or 4 if you own two sets) game that expands the world out to the continent of Solus. Where Master of Wills was a cross between Tug-O-War and Chess, Thornraver is a cross between Risk and War (and of course, Master of Wills). This is an area control game in which both players begin with an HQ and two capitals. The objective is to gain control of the Population, Resources, Regions, Leaders and Districts. You can win by majority control or eliminating your opposition.

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: The Ocean's Guard
boardgame.description:
Tristan Darkwater, the Phoenixborn that only rumors have known, has finally risen to the surface to answer the call of the Phoenix in The Ocean’s Guard! Behold his power as he communes with the life of every being in the ocean.

Tristan uses sympathy magic and time magic to enhance the innate abilities of his ecosystem of oceanic creatures, as seen through his Magnify ability. He uses this power to specialize in swarming the battlefield. But Tristan isn’t one to sit back passively. When the time is right, he will unleash his signature move to clear a path for his tidal wave of attacking force!

This expansion deck is ready to play, or combine cards with your favorite allies and spells to create the ultimate Phoenixborn deck!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: The Scholar of Ruin
boardgame.description:
Rowan uses ceremonial and time magic to excavate the physical and temporal ruins surrounding the historic battle site of Abylon. This original home of the legendary Phoenixborn Jericho is a powerful well of dormant magic, and Rowan will stop at nothing to harness it! Rowan’s pair of abilities allows him dynamic access to the powerful abilities of his closest allies, letting him simulate their life and death in an instant to reap the rewards of their lifetime of work! The ruins of Abylon’s outskirts are not easy to navigate, so Rowan will need many lifetimes worth of knowledge to make his grand discovery a reality.

This expansion deck is ready to play, or combine cards with your favorite allies and spells to create the ultimate Phoenixborn deck!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Forgotten Crowns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pallatia, the Ruler's Rest, is a dimension of floating isles where those of noble achievements and royal blood spend the afterlife. Eons ago the emperor god Leviatos died and since then his planar home has slowly frayed and weakened, only breaking just now. The long dead kings and empresses that dwell there have slowly gone mad in the absence of their deity, and the broken energies sustaining their home are trapping dimensional travelers—and worse. Things from beyond and below have begun to invade Pallatia, hastening its end and the total destruction of any soul within.

What's inside Forgotten Crowns:

An adventure in a decaying and doomed dimension for PCs of 23rd level.
Battles within the rib cage of a dead god and across islands that float in midair.
Statistics for cosmic monsters like the arnsenon and limpocait, Xydragis (the fiendish leader of the Scarlet Legion), and eight other CR 20+ enemies for epic adventurers to face.
More details about the mysterious trekth and the effects of their world runes.
Pregenerated adventurers of 23rd level for every class.

boardgame.name: Crokinole Cards
boardgame.description:
With Crokinole Cards, you will be able to play two new games on your crokinole board; Crokinole Solitaire and Crokinole Elimination. In Crokinole Solitaire, your skills will be pushed to the limits in order to survive as you play through its challenging levels! In Crokinole Elimination, a “last-one-standing” format is introduced where players compete to eliminate their opponent’s discs first. Both games are great for people of all skill levels, even if you don’t know the rules of crokinole.

Practice your shots. Improve your skills. Have a blast doing it!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Secrets of Lemuria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets of Lemuria is a short adventure for The Expanse Roleplaying Game intended for a crew of four to six 1st to 3rd level characters. The characters are hired to escort a journalist to Medina Station meet with a scientist who claims to have made a remarkable discovery on a world called Lemuria. Upon arrival at Medina, the crew learn that the scientist has been abducted. Who took her, and what are their plans for her? The crew must search Medina station in the hopes of finding her before its [sic] too late. This adventure works well as a one-shot or can easily be inserted into an existing campaign.

boardgame.name: Winged Fright
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winged Fright is a simple Q-Encounter to be dropped in when the adventurers are traveling the countryside of Dracia, or a similar lowland setting. As the sun begins to dip below the horizon and the party is ready to find a suitable place to bed down, they spot an old granary in the distance. As they relax after enjoying a quick meal and the small comfort of being out of the elements, they soon discover they are not alone.

Winged Fright is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 1st-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Dragon Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for enemies on your level? We've got you covered with our Dragon Generator.

This product contains:

9 tables to generate the description of the dragon (name, alignment, size, age, breath, color, strength, weakness, favorite food, status),
7 tables for the stats (hit points, armor class, saving throws, morale and damage),
3 tables about the dragon's lair and its treasure,
10 dragon-related situations to fuel your next adventures,

boardgame.name: Escape from New York
boardgame.description:
"You go in, find the President, bring him out in less than 24 hours, and you're a free man."

In Escape from New York, an adaptation of the John Carpenter movie of the same name, you play as Snake, Brain, Maggie, or Cabbie and attempt to rescue the president and his precious tape and bring them to safety, while dealing with the gangs of the most dangerous prison in the world – all of Manhattan.

boardgame.name: Weirdo the Great
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write-up of Weirdo The Great.

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, and tactical and plot suggestions.

boardgame.name: The Troubled Youth Encounters & Map
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Troubled Youth brings you a detailed encounter laid out in 5 beautiful pages, along with a gorgeous map and 8 versions of it.

boardgame.name: Serpent Collective
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment will introduce a new organization Serpent Collective. A group of individuals that use magic and magical devices. The question are they working for someone or working for themselves?

boardgame.name: The Witch Hunter Job Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Witch Hunter Job Guide is a new expansion for The Magical Land of Yeld, with everything you’ll need to commit yourself to Yeld’s most notorious Heroic Job. In this guide you’ll discover the history of the Old Kings and the secrets that were passed down to them from Yeld's last Dragons. Learn about the crusades against the ancient and terrifying weapons of mass destruction that were Yeld's Witches, and the equally destructive wars against the rogue Black Mages. Magic is a necessity of life in Yeld, but it is a power that always corrupts. The Witch Hunter stand ready to face that power, even if they fear they can never be its equal.

We’ve collected all the Witch Hunter specific content from the Yeld rulebook and reprinted it here, along with a selection of new Job Abilities, new Special Dice and new Treasures for you to collect! You’ll also find a brand new Mentor who is ready to instruct your young Witch Hunter and send them on a dangerous quest! This guide also includes advice for building and playing different types of Witch Hunters. Learn the secrets of the shadowy Masked Vigilante, the charismatic Faceless Saint and the magic crushing Spell Burner!

In the Witch Hunter Job Guide you’ll find:
- New background and art detailing the role of Witch Hunters in Yeld, the history of the King's People and the terror that is the true Witches!
- Learn about Yeld's most celebrated and notorious Witch Hunters. The secretive Candle Masks, the dread Abolisher Knights, the Legendary Sun King and the Witch Hunter who became Yeld's first Vampire Hunter!
- Advice for different Witch Hunter Job builds and tactics for fights, including the shadowy Masked Vigilante, the charismatic Faceless Saint and the magic crushing Spell Burner!
- Introducing the Crucible, a new kind of conflict that allows Witch Hunters to call a trial and deliver justice!
- A selection of new craftable Witch Hunter Masks, giving the Witch Hunter new tools for resisting magic and fighting against spell casters.
- Traps, a new type of weapon that allows Witch Hunters (and other Jobs and Monsters) to control the fight by placing a variety of clever and deadly Traps on the Action Board!
- New Job Specific Special dice that give Witch Hunters new options!
- New Exotic Treasure to collect, including new Masks, Clubs, Daggers and Whips!
- A Witch Hunter Mastery Quest, complete with powerful new rewards!

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: Team Covenant Ashes Reborn Discord League Alternate Art Bundle 05
boardgame.description:
A set of four alternate alt cards that came with a successful completion of the Team Covenant Ashes Discord League that started on June 1st, 2022.

This bundle includes:
1x Odette Diamondcrest alternate art card
3x Beast Tamer alternate art card
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 03
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

DRP Cyber Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Loads of packaged food and tech are in a pre-war bunker, controlled by Fiona One-eye and her crew. But a guard for a caravan of nomads has a plan.
Hashigi is a street medic now, but he used to be a suit at Zuko Multinational. He's contracted a disease he knows Zuko Multi engineered, and he knows where the cure is.

boardgame.name: Magic of the Stars (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Read Magic: Magic of the Stars brings 10 spells from the Starfinder roleplaying game and adapts, tweaks and translates them to work within the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Second Edition.

boardgame.name: Derelict Cruisers Part IV: Murder on the Oreient Express
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark ultra-short sci-fi derelict space-ship adventure-seed.

The adventurers cross path with the mining vessel the “Oreient Express”, only to find the
crew killed and the ship drifting through space on its own.

This is a small booklet (8 paged PDF-file) with a small sci-fi adventure seed. The GameMaster needs to flesh out NPC:s, add proper values (depending on what rule system you use) and perhaps create maps etc.

The adventure is fast/short and linear - but with a nice detective mystery to be solved.

boardgame.name: The Bourse of Vadashar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bourse? Of course! The Bourse of Vadashar is our premier Urban Spaces sourcebook, each one concentrating on a specific location, neighborhood, or space within the Free City. The Bourse is Vadashar's trade market, where shares in stocks, commodities, and futures are bought and sold. Fortunes are made based on the ability to transport goods to distant places, braving the vagaries of bandits, hostile monsters, and the needs of supply and demand. The Bourse of Vadashar includes a comprehensive discussion on ways for you to incorporate trade and commerce into a fantasy setting, as well as NPCs, stat blocks, adventure hooks, and more.

boardgame.name: Burst Transmissions, vol. 8
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burst Transmissions is a series of small, suggested modifications (“house rules”) and quick-and-dirty mechanics for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

This volume covers:

Governmental Structure
Highest and Lowest Points
Item Availability
Natural Satellites
Pregnancy
Quick Culture
Quick Religion
Tech Level Discrepancies

boardgame.name: GMA2: They Devour (1e/OSR/OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written for 1st Edition, 2nd Edition and OSRIC, this epic quest continues and compliments GMA1: Cult of The Rat God.

An ancient evil and its zombie horde attacks the city of Genepa. Hundreds fall and the survivors retreat behind her walls. In their distress, the city council summon the heroes and charges them with a desperate mission to recover the Book of The Unholy. With it, the Temple of Azrael hopes to learn how to disperse the undead which are acting with unusual cohesiveness and cunning. The party must locate the fabled Temple of Corruption and bring the book back to Genepa before the city gates fail and the zombie horde forces its way in. You must hurry! Time is short.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Lunar Outpost
boardgame.description:
In Lunar Outpost, players work together to mine lunar elements and build a circular base on the moon. Players can choose to build a starter base, habitat colony, research center, or manufacturing facility. Each type of base is comprised of different "modules", such as a solar monitor or a machine shop, some of which allow the players to do more as the game goes on. The game also comes with a "training mission" to get new players up to speed.

Throughout the game, players need to contend with events ranging from oxygen leaks to meteorite strikes. A newly created Alexa skill serves as Mission Control, keeping track of the team's progress and announcing the special events for each round; players can also play offline using a deck of event cards.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Swamps (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Dressing: Swamps presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Sucesos Argentinos: Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano promo card
boardgame.description:
A promo card for Sucesos Argentinos about the sinking of the ARA General Belgrano in the Malvinas War, adding one more event for your timeline.


Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 1 – Gobiernos y Conflictos
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 2 – Economía y Sociedad
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 3 – Ciencia y Cultura

boardgame.name: La Piel de Toro
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

La Piel de Toro es un suplemento para La Llamada de Cthulhu 7ª edición . En él encontrarás toda la información necesaria y precisa para jugar en la España de la década de los años 20 del siglo pasado. Estructurado en seis capítulos con una introducción fascinante: In Memoriam, Ricard Ibáñez nos lleva de su mano hacia la España de Alfonso XIII.

boardgame.name: Drill Bit Dwarfs
boardgame.description:
The competition in the Lorendon mining racket is fierce and only the strong have survived; the Drill Bit Dwarfs.
Now the battle for Honor between them has pushed the competition to the limit. Become a legendary drill bit Dwarf and take on your former brethren for the crown of the Driller King.

Drill Barter Conquer!
DBD is an action packed card-driven competition featuring drilling, bartering, deck building and sabotage of course!

Protect your mine!
Cut barter deals with factions to defend your mine and repair it.

Fill Faction Orders
Factions Orders can reward both faction favors and honor.

Buy Enchanted Drill Bits
To build your deck, drill for gold and buy enchanted drill bits from the vendor.

Barter With Factions for Offense Strikes
Lorendon is home to powerful factions with a wide variety of offensive capabilities.
How To Take The Crown
Win by getting to 50 Honor first with your Mine still standing or when only one Mine remains, the Dwarf with the highest Honor wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rose House Expands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rose House Expands is a supplement to Vaesen: Mythic Britain and Ireland. The supplement introduces a lot of new, exciting material to expand the Society's headquarters, Rose House, in London with. The supplement covers the various facilities that Rose House already has, with which Rose House can be upgraded, but also the facilities waiting to be discovered - and among them, powerful and influential facilities that can change the scope of the campaign.

Rose House is also home to other members of the Order, each of whom can bring their own resources to the investigation of strange phenomena. The supplement introduces eight members, each of whom can support the Society if their price can be paid.


Rose House Ekspanderer er et supplement til Vaesen: Mythic Britain and Ireland. Med udvidelsen får du en masse nyt, spændende materiale til at udbygge Selskabets hovedkvarter, Rose House, i London med. Supplementet dækker de forskellige faciliteter, som Rose House allerede har, og som Rose House kan opgraderes med, men også nogle af de faciliterer, som venter på at blive opdaget – og heriblandt er nogle af de mest magtfulde og indflydelsesrige faciliteter endnu præsenteret ved et hovedkvarter.

Rose House er også hjemsted for flere andre ordensmedlemmer, som hver kan bringe deres ressourcer til efterforskningen af sager. I supplementet introduceres otte medlemmer, som hver kan støtte Selskabet, hvis man kan betale prisen for deres assistance.

boardgame.name: The Supernatural Treasure Hunt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Supernatural Treasure Hunt is a supplement for Vaesen based on Danish folklore from the 19th century.

A common belief in 19th century Denmark (and Europe) was, that blue flames marked the presence of buried treasure. Anyone daring to dig would encounter black dogs, dragons or the ‘bjergfolk’ (hill folk – nisse/dwarf) trying to stop the diggers from reaching the treasure using sorcery and illusions. At other times ghosts and revenants would guard the buried treasure. Daring treasure hunters would could follow the rules of the supernatural treasure hunt could win great riches – but the treasure hunter hired to assist might be a mere charlatan!

This supplement for Vaesen introduces the supernatural treasure hunt as a part of the Vaesen game. The first half of the supplement contains materials for the players:

A new archetype: The Treasure Hunter
New talents for the treasure hunter
New upgrade, new contacts
New items of power
For the game master there is material on how the supernatural treasure hunt takes form, a guide on how to create treasure hunts in Vaesen and suggestions for mysteries based on the treasure hunt.

An appendix contains rare accounts of the treasure hunt from Danish folklore translated to English.


Den fortryllede skattejagt er et supplement til Vaesen baseret på dansk folketro fra 1800-tallet.

En udbredt forestilling i 1800-tallets Danmark (og Europa) var, at der brændte blå flammer, hvor der var begravet skatte, og hvis man turde grave der, ville man møde sorte hunde, drager eller bjergfolket, som prøvede at hindre skattegraverne med trolddom. Andre gange huserede der spøgelser og gengangere ved de nedgravede skatte. For modige folk, der kunne overholde den overnaturlige skattejagts regler, var der stor rigdom at vinde.

Supplementet indeholder for spillerne en ny arketype, Skattejægeren med tilhørende nye talenter, nye fortryllede ting, opgraderinger og kontakter. For spilleder er der en gennemgang af folketroens skattejagte og vejledning til, hvordan mysterier kan bygges op som en fortryllet skattejagt samt flere opæg til mysterier.

boardgame.name: Werewolves in Vigsø
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Werewolves in Vigsø brings the Society to most remote parts of Jutland hunting a terrible beast. Werewolves are preying on the inhabitants of Vigsø, and next full moon will be bloody. Can the Society stop the menace from the bloodthirsty beast? What is its secret?

The mystery takes place in Jutland, Denmark, and it utilizes the lighthouse Hanstholm - An Alternative Base as its starting point. The mystery can just ea easily be played using Castle Gyllencreutz or Ravnholt Manor as headquarters.

The scenario draws upon Danish 19th century folklore on werewolves and it challenges the Society in a whole new way, as the threat may become very personal for the Society members. The mystery takes two sessions to play.


Varulve ved Vigsø bringer Selskabet til de yderste egne af Jylland i jagten på et frygteligt væsen. Varulve er løs, og ved fuldmåne bliver det blodigt. Kan Selskabet standse truslen det blodtørste bæst? Hvad er dets hemmelighed?

Mysteriet udspiller sig i Jylland, og det er oplagt at bruge Hanstholm - en alternativ base som udgangspunkt, men scenariet kan nemt bruges med Castle Gyllencreutz eller Ravnholm gods som base.

Scenariet trækker på dansk folklore fra 1800-tallet om varulve. Scenariet tager 2 spilgange at spille.

boardgame.name: The Town that Drowned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Town that Drowned is a a mystery for Vaesen - Nordic Horror Roleplaying Game that plays out on a dark and misty night. The mystery draws heavily on Scandinavian folklore and explores a recurring theme of towns and churches sinking into the ground.

One strange night the Society findes themselves in a strange town. A terrible curse lies over the place, and as they explore the place they find themselves richly tempted with great treasures but also the opportunity to do good. However, the wicked guardian of the town has no intention of letting the Society ever leave again.

The Town that Drowned can be easily be placed in Norway, Sweden, Denmark or Germany. It takes 1 session to play.


Byen, der sank er et mysterium til Vaesen baseret på Skandinavisk folklore om byer og kirker, der bliver opslugt.

Mysteriet begynder en nat, hvor Selskabet er på rejse, og de ankommer til en mystisk by. Snart finder de ud af, at der hviler en grum forbandelse over byen, og de vil undervejs stå over for flere fristelser, men også chancen for at redde folk fra en grum skæbne. imidlertid er det ikke ufarligt, hvor byen har en dæmonisk vogter, som ikke er til sinds at lade folk slippe levende derfra.

Byen, der sank kan nemt placeres i Norge, Sverige, Danmark eller Tyskland. Det tager typisk 1 spilgang at spille scenariet.

boardgame.name: King's Choice
boardgame.description:
King's Choice is an exciting RPG game simulating life at the European medieval royal court. Become a legendary king and recruit famous generals, meet stunning beauties, raise your heirs, suppress rebellions, and expand your empire with the ultimate goal of becoming the supreme emperor!

Source: [onemt.com The Publisher Website].

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - Gold Weapon Skins Pack
Borderlands 3: Gold Weapon Skins Pack
boardgame.description: Bring a little extra bling to your favorite weapons in Borderlands 3 with the Gold Weapon Skins Pack, available to those who pre-order. This pack contains a gold weapon trinket and gold weapon skins that are applicable to all guns in the game.

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - Designer's Cut
boardgame.description: Expand your Borderlands 3 experience with the Designer's Cut add-on content, featuring the new Arms Race mode and an additional skill tree for every Vault Hunter when you own this DLC! Arms Race is the galaxy's premier reality murder show. This endlessly replayable mode is a mad dash to gear up your Vault Hunter from scratch and extract the best loot you can find, lest you die and lose it all.

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - Amara Final Form Pack
Borderlands 3: Amara Final Form Pack
boardgame.description:
The Multiverse Final Form Amara Cosmetic Pack includes the following content, for use in Borderlands 3:

Amara's Partali Renegade Vault Hunter Head
Amara's Partali Renegade Vault Hunter Body

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - FL4K Final Form Pack
Borderlands 3: FL4K Final Form Pack
boardgame.description:
